newsitem.title: RUSSIA: NHL ICE HOCKEY-STANLEY CUP ARRIVES IN MOSCOW FOR FIRST TIME.
newsitem.headline: NHL ICE HOCKEY-STANLEY CUP ARRIVES IN MOSCOW FOR FIRST TIME.

text.p: The Stanley Cup, arguably the most prestigious trophy in North American sport, arrived in Moscow on Saturday for the first time, marking the impact Russian players have had on the NHL in recent years.

Vyacheslav Fetisov, Vyacheslav Kozlov and Igor Larionov, who play for the Detroit Red Wings, this year's winners of the Stanley Cup, were at Moscow's Sheremetyevo Airport to collect the silver, metre-high trophy.
Felisiov, Kozlov and Larionov exercised their right as members of the winning team to exhibit the cup in their own country for three days.
